column5: this has been in the news lately, has anyone ever had any problem with them after visiting a camp or lodge? this could be anywhere not just canada. its in the back of my mind now. thanks alan

It is going to be -34 on Friday, so they will probably freeze out in the unheated cabins. I would think it would be unlikely any would be brought in, unless someone was unlucky enough to get them at a motel on the way up. It would seem, most people with the wherewithall to come to Canada fishing, would not be the normal suspect to carry bedbugs, of course the Nevada folks are a little suspect.
The no-see-ums are quite enough already
the no seeums got me good in 2009...nothing last year thankfully
I've only run into them at camps where Chicago Bears fans were there before us
Ohh, man, I just spewed my beer all over my keyboard.
Yeah we picked up the bedbugs staying in Green Bay on our way to Canada

Anybody know if the bug sprays will kill them?We used to hit spiders on occasion, so we'd lightly dust the cabins beds and such with bug spray before we used them, probably did more harm to us, but never had spider bites after that.Al
